Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a RocketMQ push consumer with Spring integration capabilities, allowing for configuration through properties and proper lifecycle management.

Class Description: The Consumer class is a Spring FactoryBean that creates and manages a RocketMQ DefaultMQPushConsumer instance. It implements InitializingBean for initialization and DisposableBean for cleanup, providing a convenient way to integrate RocketMQ consumers into Spring applications. The class offers extensive configuration options for consumer behavior and performance tuning.

Attributes:

consumerGroup: String - The consumer group name for this consumer
namesrvAddr: String - The address of the NameServer
instanceName: String - The instance name for this consumer
messageModel: MessageModel - The message model (CLUSTERING or BROADCASTING)
consumeThreadMin: int - Minimum thread pool size for message consumption
consumeThreadMax: int - Maximum thread pool size for message consumption
pullThresholdForQueue: int - Flow control threshold for queue
pullThresholdSizeForQueue: int - Flow control threshold for queue size
consumeMessageBatchMaxSize: int - Maximum number of messages consumed in one batch
pullBatchSize: int - Maximum number of messages pulled in one batch
maxReconsumeTimes: int - Maximum number of retry attempts
consumeTimeout: long - Timeout for message consumption
topic: String - The topic to subscribe to
tags: String - The tag filter for subscribed messages
messageListener: MessageListenerConcurrently - The listener for processing received messages
consumer: DefaultMQPushConsumer - The actual RocketMQ consumer instance

Methods:

afterPropertiesSet(): void - Initializes and starts the consumer after properties are set (from InitializingBean)
destroy(): void - Shuts down the consumer when the Spring context is destroyed (from DisposableBean)
getObject(): DefaultMQPushConsumer - Returns the consumer instance (from FactoryBean)
getObjectType(): Class<?> - Returns the consumer class type (from FactoryBean)
isSingleton(): boolean - Indicates this is a singleton bean (from FactoryBean)
setConsumerGroup(String): void - Sets the consumer group name
setNamesrvAddr(String): void - Sets the NameServer address
setInstanceName(String): void - Sets the instance name
setMessageModel(String): void - Sets the message model
setConsumeThreadMin(int): void - Sets minimum consumption threads
setConsumeThreadMax(int): void - Sets maximum consumption threads
setPullThresholdForQueue(int): void - Sets queue flow control threshold
setPullThresholdSizeForQueue(int): void - Sets queue size flow control threshold
setConsumeMessageBatchMaxSize(int): void - Sets batch consumption size
setPullBatchSize(int): void - Sets pull batch size
setMaxReconsumeTimes(int): void - Sets maximum retry attempts
setConsumeTimeout(long): void - Sets consumption timeout
setTopic(String): void - Sets subscription topic
setTags(String): void - Sets message tag filter
setMessageListener(MessageListenerConcurrently): void - Sets the message listener
